intro: Chrysodium hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy chrysodium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which help in reducing water loss in its native arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chrysodium hirsutum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
